title: Identifiers
description: Identifiers are used to identify different entities such as buildings, components, data sets, institutions, methods, and many others. They are either centrally managed by `buildingenvelopedata.org` or decentrally for example by a building owner. Components may either have a central identifier for example as a general product or a decentral identifier for example for specific instances of a product in a specific building.

central.title: Central identifier
central.description: Identifier issued by the metabase `buildingenvelopedata.org`. The metabase guarantees the identifier's uniqueness within its scope and maintains at least meta information about whatever the identifier identifies. The metabase issues for example central identifiers for components, institutions, and methods and guarantees their uniqueness.

decentral.title: Decentral identifier
decentral.description: Identifier issued by some database registered at the metabase `buildingenvelopedata.org`. The database guarantees the identifier's uniqueness within its scope and maintains whatever the identifier identifies. Databases issue for example identifiers for measurement, simulation, and conversion data of components.

value.description: Identifier issued by the database identified by `issuedBy` within the metabase `buildingenvelopedata.org`.

issuedBy.description: Identifier of the database that issued the identifier `value`. The database guarantees the uniqueness of `value` within the database's scope and maintains whatever `value` identifies.

centralOrDecentral.title: Either a central or decentral identifier
centralOrDecentral.description: For example, a component can be a general product, in which case it has a central identifier issued by the metabase `buildingenvelopedata.org`. However, a component can also be a specific instance of a product in a specific building, in which case it has a decentral identifier from the owner of the building.
